    • pruneAndRegraft

      public void pruneAndRegraft​(Phylogeny.Node pruned_node, Phylogeny.Node graft_position, boolean graft_into)
      Subtree prune and regraft.
      Parameters:
      pruned_node - this is the node cut with its subtree
      graft_position - where it gets attached
      graft_into - whether node should become a new child, or rather a sibling (new node inserted on edge to graft position)

    • filterLeaves

    • cleanUnaryNodes

      private int cleanUnaryNodes()
      Removes single-child nodes (including root if necessary).
      Returns:
      number of nodes removed

    • regraft

      private void regraft​(Phylogeny.Node pruned_node, Phylogeny.Node graft_position, boolean graft_into)
      Subtree prune and regraft: node is detached and placed at a new position. If grafted into, then the pruned node becomes a new child of the graft node. If not grafted into, then the graft node is replaced by a new node, with graft node on left and pruned node on right. In the latter case, if the graft node has length, then the new node is placed at halfway. The pruned node always retains its length.
      Parameters:
      pruned_node - ths node gets detached and become s rightmost child at the new placement; or if no parent there is no detachment
      graft_position - where it gets attached
      graft_into - whether node should become a new child, or rather a sibling (new node inserted on edge to graft position)

    • copyFromTree

      private void copyFromTree​(IndexedTree tree)

    • computeIndexes

      protected void computeIndexes()
      Sets the Phylogeny.Node.node_idx fields, and fills up the nodes array.

    • fixZeroEdges

      public int fixZeroEdges()
      Replaces 0-length at terminal edges with a tiny positive length; (** fuses 0-length inner edges into parent **).
      Returns:
      number of edges modified (inner removed + terminal stretched)
